alert.note: Alert for Lee; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 2:52PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lee and northeastern Sumter Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 251 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Elliott, or 9 miles south of Bishopville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elliott, Lynchburg, Manville, Wisacky and St. Charles. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 125 and 126. Interstate 95 between mile markers 143 and 146. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
